intro: Calandrinia gayana var. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular calandrinia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to drought conditions. Its flowers are often pink or red, and they bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The variety glandulosa is distinguished by the presence of glandular structures on its stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical features.
